Domine: et refugium meum
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: et līberātor meus. Deus meus adjūtor meus
O Lord: et spērābō in eum; prōtector meus
column6: et susceptor meus. ^ The Lord is my firmament
column8: and my deliverer. My God is my helper
column9: and in him will I put my trust; my protector
column10: and the horn of my salvation

Domine: et ab inimīcīs meīs salvus erō. ^ Praising
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: I will call upon the Lord
O Lord: and I shall be saved from my enemies.

Domine: et torrentēs inīquitātis conturbāvērunt mē. ^ The sorrows of death surrounded me
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and the torrents of iniquity troubled me.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 6 ^ Dolōrēs infernī circumdedērunt mē; praeoccupāvērunt mē laqueī mortis. ^ The sorrows of hell encompassed me; the snares of death prevented me.

Domine: et ad Deum meum clāmāvī; exaudīvit dē templō sānctō suō vōcem meam
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: et clāmor meus in conspectū ejus introībit in aurēs ejus. ^ In my affliction I called upon the Lord
O Lord: and I cried to my God; he heard my voice from his holy temple
and my cry before him will enter into his ears.

Domine: et contremuit terra; fundāmenta montium conturbāta sunt
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: et commōta sunt
O Lord: quoniam īrātus est eīs. ^ The earth shook and trembled; the foundations of the mountains were troubled
column6: because he was angry with them.

Domine: et ignis ā faciē ejus exarsit; carbōnēs succensī sunt ab eō. ^ There went up a smoke in his wrath
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and a fire flamed from his face; coals were kindled by it.

Domine: et dēscendit
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: et cālīgō sub pedibus ejus. ^ He bowed the heavens
O Lord: and came down
and darkness was under his feet.

Domine: et volāvit; volāvit super pennās ventōrum. ^ And he ascended upon the cherubim
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and he flew; he flew upon the wings of the winds.

Domine: in circumitū ejus tabernāculum ejus; tenebrōsa aqua in nūbibus āeris. ^ And he made darkness his cover
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: his pavilion round about him; dark water in the clouds of the air.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 13 ^ Prae fulgōre in conspectū ejus nūbēs transīvērunt; grandō et carbōnēs ignis. ^ At the brightness that was before him the clouds passed; hail and coals of fire.

Domine: et Altissimus dedit vōcem suam; grandō et carbōnēs ignis. ^ And the Lord thundered from heaven
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and the Highest gave his voice; hail and coals of fire.

Domine: et dissipāvit eōs; fulgura multiplicāvit
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: et conturbāvit eōs. ^ And he sent forth his arrows
O Lord: and he scattered them; he multiplied lightnings

Domine: et revēlāta sunt fundāmenta orbis terrārum; ab increpātiōne tuā
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: Domine
O Lord: ab inspīrātiōne spīritūs īrae tuae. ^ Then the fountains of waters appeared
and the foundations of the world were discovered; at thy rebuke
column7: at the blast of the spirit of thy wrath.

Domine: et accēpit mē
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: et assumpsit mē dē aquīs multīs. ^ He sent from on high
O Lord: and took me
and received me out of many waters.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 18 ^ Ēripuit mē dē inimīcīs meīs fortissimīs
Domine: et ab hīs quī ōdērunt mē
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: quoniam confortātī sunt super mē. ^ He delivered me from my strongest enemies
O Lord: and from them that hated me
for they were too strong for me.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 19 ^ Praevēnērunt mē in diē afflictiōnis meae
Domine: et factus est Dominus prōtector meus. ^ They prevented me in the day of my affliction
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and the Lord became my protector.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 20 ^ Et ēdūxit mē in lātitūdinem; salvum mē fēcit
Domine: quoniam voluit mē. ^ And he brought me forth into a large place; he saved me
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: because he was well pleased with me.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 21 ^ Et retribuet mihi Dominus secundum jūstitiam meam
Domine: et secundum pūritātem manuum meārum retribuet mihi
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: ^ And the Lord will reward me according to my justice; and will repay me according to the cleanness of my hands

Domine: nec impiē gessī ā Deō meō
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: ^ because I have kept the ways of the Lord
O Lord: and have not done wickedly against my God

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 23 ^ quoniam omnia jūdicia ejus in conspectū meō
Domine: et jūstitiās ejus nōn repulī ā mē. ^ for all his judgments are in my sight
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and his justices I have not put away from me.

Domine: et observābō mē ab inīquitāte meā. ^ And I shall be spotless with him
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and shall keep myself from my iniquity.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 25 ^ Et retribuet mihi Dominus secundum jūstitiam meam
Domine: et secundum pūritātem manuum meārum in conspectū oculōrum ejus. ^ And the Lord will reward me according to my justice
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and according to the cleanness of my hands before his eyes.

Domine: et cum virō innocente innocens eris
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: ^ With the holy thou wilt be holy
O Lord: and with the innocent man thou wilt be innocent

Domine: et cum perversō perverteris. ^ and with the elect thou wilt be elect
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and with the perverse thou wilt be perverted.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 28 ^ Quoniam tū populum humilem salvum faciēs
Domine: et oculōs superbōrum humiliābis. ^ For thou wilt save the humble people
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: but wilt bring down the eyes of the proud.

Domine: Domine; Deus meus
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: illūminā tenebrās meās. ^ For thou lightest my lamp
O Lord: O Lord; O my God

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 30 ^ Quoniam in tē ēripier ā tentātiōne
Domine: et in Deō meō transgredier mūrum. ^ For by thee I shall be delivered from temptation
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and through my God I shall go over a wall.

Domine: impollūta via ejus; ēloquia Dominī igne exāminātā; prōtector est omnium spērantium in sē. ^ As for my God
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: his way is undefiled; the words of the Lord are fire-tried; he is the protector of all that trust in him.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 32 ^ ¿Quoniam quis Deus praeter Dominum? ¿Aut quis Deus praeter Deum nostrum? ^ For who is God but the Lord? Or who is God but our God?

Domine: et posuit immaculātam viam meam; ^ God
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: who hath girt me with strength
O Lord: and made my way blameless;

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 34 ^ quī perfēcit pedēs meōs tamquam cervōrum
Domine: et super excelsa statuens mē; ^ who hath made my feet like the feet of harts
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and who setteth me upon high places;

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 35 ^ quī docet manūs meās ad praelium
Domine: et posuistī
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: ut arcum aereum
O Lord: bracchia mea. ^ who teacheth my hands to war

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 36 ^ Et dedistī mihi prōtectiōnem salūtis tuae
Domine: et dextera tua suscēpit mē
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: et disciplīna tua corrēxit mē in fīnem
O Lord: et disciplīna tua ipsa mē docēbit. ^ And thou hast given me the protection of thy salvation
and thy right hand hath held me up
column6: and thy discipline hath corrected me unto the end
column7: and thy discipline itself shall teach me.

Domine: et nōn sunt infirmāta vestīgia mea. ^ Thou hast enlarged my steps under me
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and my feet are not weakened.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 38 ^ Persequer inimīcōs meōs et comprehendem illōs
Domine: et nōn converter dōnec dēficiant. ^ I will pursue after my enemies and overtake them
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and I will not turn again till they are consumed.

Domine: nec poterunt stāre; cadent subtus pedēs meōs. ^ I will break them
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and they shall not be able to stand; they shall fall under my feet.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 40 ^ Et praecīnxistī mē virtūte ad bellum
Domine: et supplantāvistī insurgentēs in mē subtus mē. ^ And thou hast girded me with strength unto battle
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and hast subdued under me them that rose up against me.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 41 ^ Et inimīcōs meōs dedistī mihi dorsum
Domine: et odientēs mē disperdidistī. ^ And thou hast made my enemies turn their back upon me
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: and hast destroyed them that hated me.

Domine: nec erat quī salvōs faceret
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: ad Dominum
O Lord: nec exaudīvit eōs. ^ They cried
but there was none to save them

Domine: ut pulverem ante faciem ventī; ut lutum platēārum dēlēbō eōs. ^ And I shall beat them as small as the dust before the wind; like the dirt of the streets I shall bring them to nought.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 44 ^ Ēripiēs mē dē contrādictiōnibus populī; constituēs mē in caput Gentium. ^ Thou wilt deliver me from the contradictions of the people; thou wilt make me head of the Gentiles.

Domine: servīvit mihi; in audītū auris obēdīvit mihi. ^ A people which I knew not
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: hath served me; at the hearing of the ear they have obeyed me.

Domine: fīliī aliēnī inveterātī sunt
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: et claudicāvērunt ā sēmitīs suīs. ^ The children that are strangers have lied to me
O Lord: strange children have faded away
and have halted from their paths.

Domine: et benedictus Deus meus
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: et exaltētur Deus salūtis meae. ^ The Lord liveth
O Lord: and blessed be my God
and let the God of my salvation be exalted.

Domine: quī dās vindictās mihi
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: et subdis populōs sub mē; līberātor meus dē inimīcīs meīs īrācundīs. ^ O God
O Lord: who avengest me
and subduest the people under me; my deliverer from my enraged enemies.

2 ^ Dīligem tē: 49 ^ Et ab insurgentibus in mē exaltābis mē; ā virō inīquō ēripiēs mē. ^ And thou wilt lift me up above them that rise up against me; from the unjust man thou wilt deliver me.

Domine: Domine
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: et nōminī tuō psalmum dīcem
O Lord: ^ Therefore will I give glory to thee among the nations
column6: and I will sing a psalm to thy name

Domine: et faciens misericordiam chrīstō suō Dāvid
fortitūdō mea. ^ I will love thee: et sēminī ejus usque in saeculum. ^ giving great deliverance to his king
O Lord: and showing mercy to David his anointed
and to his seed for ever.
